article_title: Six Financial Mistakes People Make When Retiring Abroad
article_text:
Retiring abroad may sound idyllic. But those who fall short on financial planning can pay a big price.

For the 380,000 retirees who live abroad, according to the Social Security Administration—up from 307,000 in 2008—the potential missteps are numerous. Amid a U.S. crackdown on money laundering, tax evasion and non-compliance with tax-reporting obligations, some expats are being cut off by their banks and brokerage firms. Others are...

twitter.description: The six common financial mistakes people make when retiring abroad. Among them: running afoul of IRS rules.
twitter.creator: @Annetergesen
